words.title: convivial
words.wordDefinition: (of an atmosphere or event) friendly, lively, and enjoyable.

words.title: concomitant
words.wordDefinition: naturally accompanying or associated.

words.title: condign
words.wordDefinition: (of punishment or retribution) appropriate to the crime or wrongdoing; fitting and deserved.

words.title: melliferous
words.wordDefinition: yielding or producing honey.

words.title: commodious
words.wordDefinition: (especially of furniture or a building) roomy and comfortable.

words.title: conflagration
words.wordDefinition: an extensive fire which destroys a great deal of land or property

words.title: forsooth
words.wordDefinition: an extensive fire which destroys a great deal of land or property

words.title: besmirch
words.wordDefinition: damage the reputation of (someone or something) in the opinion of others

words.title: felicitate
words.wordDefinition: congratulate

words.title: remonstrance
words.wordDefinition: a forcefully reproachful protest

words.title: ternary
words.wordDefinition: composed of three parts.

words.title: bullock
words.wordDefinition: another term for steer

words.title: equivocation
words.wordDefinition: the use of ambiguous language to conceal the truth or to avoid committing oneself; prevarication

words.title: rusticate
words.wordDefinition: go to, live in, or spend time in the country

words.title: emulous
words.wordDefinition: seeking to emulate or imitate someone or something

words.title: aggrandize
words.wordDefinition: increase the power, status, or wealth of

words.title: prevaricate
words.wordDefinition: speak or act in an evasive way

words.title: dignify
words.wordDefinition: make (something) seem worthy and impressive

words.title: wherewith
words.wordDefinition: with or by which

words.title: extirpate
words.wordDefinition: root out and destroy completely

words.title: tremulous
words.wordDefinition: shaking or quivering slightly

words.title: annuity
words.wordDefinition: a fixed sum of money paid to someone each year, typically for the rest of their life

words.title: premise
words.wordDefinition: a previous staement or proposition form which another is inferred or fllows as a conclusion

words.title: appertain
words.wordDefinition: (appertain to) relate to; concern

words.title: vicinal
words.wordDefinition: neighboring; adjacent.

words.title: liminal
words.wordDefinition: relating to a transitional or initial stage of a process

words.title: niveous
words.wordDefinition: snowy or resembling snow

words.title: idem
words.wordDefinition: used in citations to indicate an author or work that has just been mentioned

words.title: inimical
words.wordDefinition: tending to obstruct or harm

words.title: Anodyne
words.wordDefinition: not likely to provoke dissent or offense; inoffensive, often deliberately so

words.title: elide
words.wordDefinition: omit (a sound or syllable) when speaking; join together; merge

words.title: Moorings
words.wordDefinition: a place where a boat or ship is moored

words.title: depredation
words.wordDefinition: an act of attacking or plundering

words.title: tawny
words.wordDefinition: of an orange-brown or yellowish-brown color

words.title: ere
words.wordDefinition: before (in time)
